entry.title: Finatra Release 2.1.6 Is Now Available!
entry.content:
Finatra Release 2.1.6 is now available from Maven Central.

As previously noted, Finatra 2.1.6 will be our final release to support Scala 2.10 and Java 7. Future releases will be Scala 2.11 and Java 8 only until Scala 2.12 support is added for Finagle at which time we’ll cross-compile for Scala 2.11 and 2.12.

Please checkout the v2.1.6 release notes on github for more information. As always, you can download the release from Maven Central.

See the Finatra Github page or checkout our User Guide for more information on getting started.

– The Finatra Team | forum | @finatra | chat

entry.title: Announcing the Final Scala 2.10 and Java 7 Release
entry.content:
Our upcoming release: v2.1.6 will be our final release to support Scala 2.10 and Java 7.

Java 7 reached its end-of-life in April 2015 and we would like to begin using the Java 8 libraries in earnest. Once Scala 2.12 is released, we plan to add support for cross-compiling Scala 2.11 and 2.12. Until 2.12 is released we will only be supporting Scala 2.11.

For more information see the Finagle blog post: http://finagle.github.io/blog/2016/04/20/scala-210-and-java7/

As always, you can check out the Finatra Github page or our User Guide for more information on getting started.

– The Finatra Team | forum | @finatra | chat

entry.title: Finatra Release v2.1.5 Is Now Available!
entry.content:
Finatra Release 2.1.5 is now available from Maven Central.

Please check out the v2.1.5 release tag on Github for more information.

In addition to lots of code improvements, we’ve addressed an issue in building our tests jars with sbt that should result in smaller (and better) tests jars that only include actual test utilities (and not all of our tests). Also, we’ve switched our default branch in Github to a develop branch to bring us in-line with the other Twitter OSS libraries (e.g., scrooge, finagle, twitter-server). And lastly, if you want to contribute we’ve added a pull request template that should make it easy to craft a good pull request. See the Github documentation for more information on pull request templates.

As always, you can download the release from Maven Central.

See the Finatra Github page or check out our User Guide for more information on getting started.

– The Finatra Team

entry.title: Finatra 2.1.4 Is Now Available and Thrift Support Now Documented!
entry.content:
Finatra Release 2.1.4 is now available from Maven Central.

There are lots of improvements in this release as we focused on making bringing thrift server support to parity with http server support. Please checkout the v2.1.4 release tag on github for more information.

We’ve now also documented building thrift servers with Finatra: http://twitter.github.io/finatra/user-guide/build-new-thrift-server/.

As always, you can download the release from Maven Central.

See the Finatra Github page or checkout our User Guide for more information on getting started.

– The Finatra Team

entry.title: Announcing the Release of Finatra 2.1.3, Now Publicly Available.
entry.content:
Finatra Release 2.1.3 is now available from Maven Central.

There are lots of improvements in this release. Please checkout the v2.1.3 release tag on github for more information.

See the Finatra Github page or checkout our User Guide for more information on getting started.

– The Finatra Team
